problem.p: The box of mass m swings down from points A to B in the figure. Consider the zero of the coordinate system at the bottom of the trajectory.
Initial State: The box is at rest at point A in the figure, at a height L from the ground, where L is the portion of the string between the pulley and the box of mass m.
Final State: The box is moving with speed vB. Its height is zero.
System: the box and the Earth
Internal Interactions: The Earth and the box, the resulting force is the conservative gravitational force. Its work is represented as a potential energy.
External Interactions: box and the string, the resulting force is the force of tension that is perpendicular to the path, therefore its work is zero.
Mechanical energy and work applied to the box-Earth system is constant (no work done by external and internal forces are conservative).

p.i: Eb = EA + WABext + WABinternal, NC \(\Rightarrow\) EB = EA
